intro: Stylophyllum edule, commonly known as the edible sea palm, is a marine plant belonging to the order Zosterales. It is characterized by its bushy, branched structure and is typically found in shallow coastal waters. The plant has a bluish-green color and exhibits a unique adaptation to tidal environments. Stylophyllum edule plays a role in providing habitat for various marine organisms. Its leaves are often used in traditional cuisines in certain coastal communities.
